title: Returnal's PS5 Pro upgrade delivers a huge resolution boost and improved performance
description: To mark its fourth anniversary, developer Housemarque has announced a free PlayStation 5 Pro upgrade to Returnal, promising to give a superb PS5 game a resolution boost of up to 2.5x on Sony's Pro hardware. The exact phrasing of "up to 2.5x" does suggest a form of dynamic scaling is in play, which I'll get to in a minute - but it's a welcome move that addresses one gripe with base PS5's image quality. Beyond that, are there any other improvements to the original experience? Are the performance issues addressed and what about the slight traversal stutter issues? Read more
author: Thomas Morgan

title: Nintendo began working on Switch 2 "shortly after the release" of Switch 1, new Genki lawsuit papers reveal
description: UPDATE 2.12pm: Genki has responded to Nintendo's legal complaint, saying it is "taking it seriously", and is "proud of the work [it has] done". Read more

title: Pac-Man's Getting An Official Cookbook Later This Month
description: Video game cookbooks have become quite popular lately, and if you're in the mood to whip up some meals inspired by the original gaming icon Pac-Man, then you're in luck. Pac-Man: The Official Cookbook launches on May 13, and preorders are available now for $30 at Amazon. Pac-Man: The Official Cookbook $30 | Releases May 13 This 160-page recipe features over 60 dishes based on the Pac-Man series ranging from Inky's Wings to Pac-Mac 'n cheese. Each recipe is presented with step-by-step instructions and full-color photography to guide you through the dish's preparation. Preorder at Amazon Gallery Pac-Man fans can also look forward to a new Pac-Man Special Edition Wireless Controller from PowerA that looks like it's wrapped in a level straight out of Pac-Man's arcade days. This model features some great hardware, like Hall Effect joysticks and triggers, extra customizable buttons, and a three-way lock for triggers. The controller also glows in the dark, and it's compatible with PC, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox One. It's on sale for $90 (was $100) at AmazonIn case you don't have an appetite for Pac-Man meals, there are several other gaming-themed cookbooks you can check out. For example, there's the Persona: The Official Cookbook offers dozens of recipes inspired by Persona 3 Reload, Persona 4 Golden, and Persona 5 Royal, and it'll be released on September 23. Borderlands fans can get a taste of Pandora with the official Eat the Borderlands: One Loader Bot's Culinary Tour Through Pandora and Beyond cookbook, which will be out on July 29, and preorders are slightly discounted to just $27.89 (was $30) at Amazon. Like the Pac-Man cookbook, the Borderlands version also offers easy-to-prepare meals, as each dish in this hardcover book is accompanied by visual aids.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Relive Marvel's Biggest Comics Event With This Secret Wars Omnibus Deal
description: Secret Wars Omnibus (Hardcover) $69.20 (was $100) See at Amazon Marvel is no stranger to annual blockbuster events in its comic books, but few can compare to its 2015 mini-series Secret Wars. The culmination of years of storytelling, Secret Wars broke and rebuilt the Marvel Universe, eventually forming a new status quo in the comic books. The massive crossover event centers on the Fantastic Four's leader, Reed Richards, and judging from the few details we know about the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday, it appears the new film will draw from elements of Secret Wars, making now the perfect time to catch up on the storyline. Luckily, Marvel recently published a massive hardcover Secret Wars omnibus edition that collects the entire run and several tie-in issues, and it's on sale for just $69.20 (was $100) at Amazon. Secret Wars Omnibus (Hardcover) $69.20 (was $100) The Secret Wars hardcover collection includes all nine issues of Secret Wars, the 2015 Free Comic Book Day Secret Wars 0 issue, as well as dozens of Avengers comics that tied into the Secret Wars storyline. Here's everything included:Avengers (2012) Issues 35-44New Avengers (2013) Issues 24-33Secret Wars Issue 0Secret Wars (2015) Issues 1-9If you never read it, Secret Wars is set after the Marvel multiverse was destroyed, with only a single reality surviving the incursion events. Ruled by Doctor Doom--who had gained godlike power--various Earths had been combined into a patchwork creation known as Battleworld. This new world was full of unique domains, like a wasteland populated by zombies, a region ruled by the genocidal AI Ultron and its robot hordes, a city of demons, and much more.With various forces conspiring against Doom and survivors from previous realities crash landing on Battleworld, it's only a matter of time before war breaks out to determine the fate of Battleworld and the Marvel universe. See at Amazon This isn't the first Secret Wars mini-series published by Marvel, as this title was first used in a 1984 mini-series. The 2015 version is a spiritual successor, but if you'd like to read the original, you can grab a paperback edition for just $17 (was $35). The original Secret Wars was Marvel's first major crossover event and ran for 12 issues, featuring the Avengers, Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four, and the X-Men pitted against their major foes by the unbelievably powerful Beyonder.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Tom Cruise Promises Underwater Sequence 'Unlike Any Other' In Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning
description: From speeding trains to flying motorcycles, Tom Cruise has continuously tried to one-up himself with each successive Mission: Impossible movie, sometimes breaking bones in the process. So what could he possibly do in Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning to raise the bar? Well, hanging off the side of an airplane…Read more...

title: The Sunday Papers
description: Well! A one-week Sunday Papers break turned into three, prompted by the seemingly endless school holiday at Easter. Now I return and-- Monday is another holiday? Blimey. Nevertheless, let's do some links. Polygon, one of the last video game outlets with a reputation for long form reporting and feature writing, was sold to Valnet, a content farm best known for paying writers terribly and being founded by porn peddlers. Most of the staff were immediately fired. Local arsonist believes smouldering rubble has "a lot of potential and could be much more." Read more
author: Graham Smith

title: The Shadow Syndicate mixes a bit of LA Noire, a touch of Max Payne, and furries to make a game you should keep your eye on
description: Do you ever think to yourself, "gee, I wish that LA Noire actually looked like a noir film and also everyone is a furry"? Then boy howdy do I have the game for you: The Shadow Syndicate. It just got announced yesterday at the Gamescom Latam showcase, and I should say it's not exactly like LA Noire in that you don't have to try and read the faces of motion capture actors overperforming their hearts out. What it does have is some detective work, gunplay, and even some Max Payneish bullet-time. How can you not be into that mixture? Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Ecco the Dolphin is getting two remasters and one new title from its original creators
description: I will take good news where I can get it and today that good news comes from Ecco the Dolphin creator Ed Annunziata. In an interview with Xbox Wire, Annunziata said remasters of the original Ecco game and its sequel are coming — plus something new. He pointed folks to the Ecco the Dolphin website, […]

title: Every tease Marvel still needs to pay off, in theory
description: Over the past 17 years, Marvel Studios has focused as much on the continuity of its ongoing mega-story as it’s focused on the content of any given superhero film. title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 877
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Pick how much ice you’d like in your drink: all the way to the brim, half full, a few cubes or no ice at all? Half full, please. That’s purr-fect! 2. Have you ever raised a puppy or a kitten? Yes. It’s a wonderful experience, but be prepared to have your nice things destroyed! Oh, and you can forget about your couch ever looking pristine again. 3. How often do you hit the snooze button in the morning? Just once. I used to just get up when the alarm went right off, but lately, eh, I’ve been loving a little extra sleep. 4. What decade has the best clothes? I’m probably biased because I wish I could go back to 1998 at least once a day, but[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 877 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 876
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What sports would you have liked to have played as a kid? I would’ve loved to have taken dance classes. I think I would’ve enjoyed soccer, too. 2. Would you rather listen to the radio or replay a favorite album? Replay a favorite album. Speaking of that, my family will probably freak out if I play the greatest hits from Fleetwood Mac one more time. 3. Have you ever had a job where you had to be on your feet all day? Yup. I’ve done retail and worked in the back of the house in a bakery. Gotta have supportive shoes! 4. Do you have any travel plans for the summer? Right now we’ve got one camping trip to the Russian River planned, and that’s it. I[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 876 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
